title: UBS pegs $15.4 billion enterprise value to Zomato's Blinkit business
description: UBS valued Zomato at $32.1 billion – a 15% premium over its current market capitalisation of $27.8 billion. As of July, the brokerage firm estimated Blinkit’s market share at 40-45%, with Swiggy's Instamart at 20-25%, followed by Nexus Venture Partners-backed Zepto at 15-20%, and Big Basket’s BBNow at 10-15%.
content: With an enterprise value of $15.4 billion, quick commerce platform Blinkit is contributing a higher share to Zomato’s valuation than the Gurugram-based company’s mainstay food delivery business, according to UBS.The brokerage firm valued Zomato at $32.1 billion – a 15% premium over its current market capitalisation of $27.8 billion. “While quick commerce has emerged as the new growth driver as the service expands into newer cities and categories, food delivery growth has also surprised positively at (around) 25% vs consensus closer to 20%,” UBS said in a report.Earlier this month, Blinkit announced an aggressive expansion plan to grow its network of dark stores – or micro warehouses – to 2,000 by 2026. The platform had 639 dark stores as of June-end.UBS also pointed to growing competitive intensity in the quick commerce business, with several new firms looking to enter the space.
